units.title: Prepare HBSS/BSA/glucose with DNase
units.text:
Obtain a 60 mm cell culture dish containing ~7 mL of HBSS/BSA/glucose.
Add 150 µL of pre-aliquoted DNase (10 mg/mL) to each dish.
units.rationale: This is an actionable preparation step critical for tissue digestion.

units.title: Cut brain tissue into small chunks
units.text: With a scalpel, cut tissue into small (~2 mm × 2 mm chunks) in HBSS/BSA/glucose + DNase solution in a sterile environment (Fig. 2).
units.rationale: This is a precise, hands-on procedural step essential for effective digestion.

units.title: Distribute tissue into conical tubes with collagenase/dispase
units.text:
Distribute tissue into three 15 mL conical tubes.
• Aliquot the tissue–buffer solution in the dish into the tubes first
• Use extra HBSS/BSA/glucose buffer to wash the dish and make up to 5 mL per tube
Add 167 µL of collagenase/dispase (100 mg/mL) to each tube.
units.rationale: This step standardizes sample processing and enzyme concentration for digestion.

units.title: Digest tissue in rotating oven
units.text: Digest for 30 min in rotating oven at 37 °C.
units.rationale: This is a time- and temperature-controlled procedural step critical for enzymatic digestion.

units.title: Spin down digestion mixture
units.rationale: This centrifugation step isolates the cell pellet after digestion.

units.title: Prepare Percoll density gradient
units.text:
Dispense 4 mL of 22% Percoll into each new conical tube.
Carefully dispense cell suspension from each sample tube into the new conical tubes containing 22% Percoll in equal amounts. Use ~750 µL per tube.
units.rationale: This step sets up the density gradient for cell separation, a key protocol action.

units.title: Centrifuge Percoll gradient
units.text: Spin down for 10 min at 500g, 4 °C with no deceleration.
units.rationale: This centrifugation is a critical procedural step to separate cell populations by density.

units.title: Prepare master mix for immunostaining
units.text:
Add 200 µL of HBSS/BSA/glucose into a fresh tube.
Add 2 µL of each antibody and 1 µL of DAPI into the tube containing 200 µL of HBSS/BSA/glucose per sample.
units.rationale: This is a precise reagent mixing step required for downstream staining.

units.title: Immunostain cells
units.text:
Resuspend in ~200 µL of HBSS/BSA/glucose.
Add the master mix into the tube of resuspended cells.
Incubate for 15 min on ice.
units.rationale: This is a time- and temperature-controlled staining procedure essential for flow cytometry.

units.title: Set up FACS controls with beads
units.text:
Dispense 250 µL of HBSS/BSA/glucose into each of the four remaining FACS tubes.
Add 2.5 µL of a single antibody to each single-color control tube into the FACS tubes containing 250 µL of HBSS/BSA/glucose.
For the live/dead stain, add 1.25 µL of DAPI into the FACS tubes containing 250 µL of combined buffer/cell rinse. One tube will be unstained.
After adding antibodies as explained in Step 43, shake the UltraComp eBead vial and add one drop of beads to each single-color control with the ‘Ready to Use’ bottle.
units.rationale: This is a detailed, actionable protocol for preparing flow cytometry controls using beads.
